newsitem.title: GREECE: Greek equities climb, overcome 1,400 pts hurdle.
newsitem.headline: Greek equities climb, overcome 1,400 pts hurdle.

text.p: Greek stocks settled 1.33 percent higher on Wednesday, with insurance and industrial shares leading and analysts saying the bourse would consolidate this week.

"Turnover grew on Wednesday, as buying interest became stronger. There were positive news in the press with regard to the profitability of banks, especially big state-owned ones," said investment analyst John Haveles, at Delphi Mutual Funds.
Investors are also awaiting financial results and forecasts from the industrial sector as well, he added. He expected the market to consolidate this week, with a resistance level at 1,450-60 points.

Following a better-than-expected March CPI inflation figure -- 6.0 percent -- banks started a new round of interest rate cuts last week. The focus now is on April CPI which is expected to dip below 6.0 percent.
An informal Reuters poll of bankers and economists produced a mean forecast of 5.7 percent. Forecasts ranged from 5.5 - 6.0 percent.
The Athens general share index ended 1.33 percent or 18.53 points higher at 1,413.42 from Tuesday's 1,394.89 close, after opening at 1,400.87.
Turnover rose to 15.0 billion drachmas on volume of 4.4 million shares. Advancers led decliners 136 to 77 with 23 issues unchanged on 236 traded.
Banks firmed 1.31 percent and construction gained 0.03 percent. Industrials rose 2.01 percent and insurance climbed 2.21 percent.
